SENT.plain: Ectopia lentis in children continues to be a diagnostic and therapeutic challenge for ophthalmologists
It can occur in isolation, in association with other ocular disorders or as part of systemic disorder
Marfan's syndrom and homocystinuria are the most frequent cause of heritable ectopia lentis
The authors describe ocular findings and clinical symptoms diseases with ectopia lentis
Differential diagnostic and treatment methods are discussed
